website_summaries.verdict: Formidable pedal for front-line distortion. Shines for soaring leads and arena-rock rhythm tones.
pros: Has a distinctive crisp and dirty rock sound
Versatile enough to be used on guitars and bass guitars
cons: Can sound slightly muddy on extended range guitars

customer_reviews.title: Best option to whiteface.
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 whiteface rats and a WF reissue. Been using them since 83 as a full time musician. I only use rat pedals for soloing. I always wanted more headroom and perhaps more bass or "filter" as they call it. This solves the problem, as it will run from 9-18 volts. I use a 12 v supply on it, and do not need the "fat" switch as the headroom allows for lower frequencies. Natural compression, socketed IC (installed a well used LM308N), and LED (what the WF has been missing). This will be a classic. Its taller than the WF rat, so you may miss the switch on stage a couple of times before you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cash

customer_reviews.title: IDK what people see in Rat pedals
customer_reviews.text: This HAS to be a difference in FX preference because everyone loves this thing but I honestly think it sounds like hot fizzy garbage. There's basically mud or scratchy fizzy fuzz that sounds like it wants to be death metal but it just sounds horrible. It was super durable though. I could beat someone to death with this brick of a pedal and I guarantee you it'd still work like it's brand new... But that doesn't mean it's worth using. Walrus Audio's Iron Horse V2 fixed literally everything I couldn't stand about the Rat.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Mess

customer_reviews.title: Great Historical Pedal with a Nasty Attitude!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this Pedal. It's got crunch, tone and best of all.....an attitude. It's wide range of tone created with only 3 dials allows me to play with my "attitude" at the time. I've had this pedal now for over a year , demanding a lot from it and it has not failed me. I am a recreational player that leans toward older style pedals that are pretty much outdated and irrelevant to modern day pedals. This pedal works great on it's own or can get along with multiple others on your board. Take a chance & go for it!
customer_reviews.author: SRF

customer_reviews.title: Nothing beats the real thing!
customer_reviews.text: Yes some clones come close on certain settings but aren't as versatile. You can use the RAT as a boost, low overdrive, aggressive low distortion, plain old distortion and even fuzz. The clones I've tried sound similar with middle of the road settings but fall short when it comes to usability over the whole range.
customer_reviews.author: TalmabuK

customer_reviews.title: Buzzes incessantly
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding, instantly recognizable distortion made worthless by a constant buzz and hum. If you can get a vintage Rat, I'd do it, but probably stay away from the Rat2 -- unless I just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan D

customer_reviews.title: RAT is coming back to relevance, and for good reason.
customer_reviews.text: RAT sounds great, which is pretty much known. Good fat tone, which I think is great for people who love the fullness of a fuzz but don't like the muddy shrillness of their tone. But what you might not realize is that it has an incredibly durable construction, and they put their trust in their product with a 5-Year warranty. If you have a pedal board and you don't have a RAT, you're screwing up.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: Have been playing guitar for over 30 years as a hobby. Mostly classic rock from the Beatles to AC/DC, hard to soft rock. I needed an amp with as wide a range as possible. Went with a clean Vox that covered clean to overdrive, but lacked distortion. The Rat filled the overdrive to distortion sound I needed. Rat can be controlled to give light to head banging distortion. So far so good. Built like a tank. Easy to use. Get the use tips off Internet web site for Rat for best results.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The pedal didn't work/turn on at all using a 9v an external power source. The problem isn't the power source (1 Spot) as it powers my other pedals just fine. If you order this product make sure to test it before your return window closes like mine did.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Rat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the higher gain stages, but I’ve been surprised at how much I like it in the lower settings, too. The filter knob has a sweet sweep towards the center range— it goes from warm to muddy pretty quickly when I turn it up, and it goes from bright and responsive to abrasive pretty quickly when I turn it down, but that center range of bright-to-warm is just great. I’m having a lot of fun with this pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar-Player

customer_reviews.title: A versatile little dirt box with great tone
customer_reviews.text: Although ProCo promotes this for its 90's grunge sound, it's much more than that. Dial down the Distortion knob, dial Filter up to 2 o'clock and you get Jeff Beck and John Scofield tones from it. Turn Distortion up to 4 o'clock for thick early Sabbath, and as you dial back on Filter, the tone gets sharper for 80's rock tones. It has been fun seeing how many signatures tones it can produce. Sounds great with my Fender and Marshall amps, using SC or HB pickups. My trusty Monte Allums-modded Blues Driver sounds awful next to this. If you're looking for a versatile dirt box that sounds great and is affordable, you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Coffin

customer_reviews.title: My go to Distortion
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a cheap distortion pedal with this, it sounds great, my only complaint is that they should have added some paint to the marker lines on the knobs like they did with the original Rat
customer_reviews.author: Miquel Erlandson

customer_reviews.title: THE best of the bunch!!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned few rats in the past, and this.. hands down the one that stands out more and best. As the previous reviewer said, spend a little more and get this instead the regular one. You need a booster? slight breakup? overdrive? fuzzy distortion? this is the box! Just super awesome, inexpensive and coolest! And this info might help.. you DON'T NEED TO GET THE ADAPTER!! for the dc power like in the rat 2 or big box ehx small clone. It has a regular power jack on this one, so you can plug it with your power of choice right away. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: Great Name Brand Pedal at a decent price point.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great. I really don't know what much to say about it. It's very versatile for a distortion and is one of the few distortions I have that can actually aft like an overdrive/boost as well.
customer_reviews.author: smn

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what you want.
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly new to playing guitar and the Rat 2 is my first pedal. It definitely gives great distortion and sounds good! In my lack of experience I don't have any other high end pedals to compare this one to but I feel this does a great job in itself. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Tone Master
customer_reviews.text: This pedal is exactly what I was looking for. I went through a few pedals that didn't quite fit, then I plugged this bad boy in -holy schnikes. It's two dials give you a spectrum of tone that'll get you to that metal place you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: The king of distortion pedals. It's a little fuzzier ...
customer_reviews.text: The king of distortion pedals. It's a little fuzzier than I expected with the gain cranked up but this offers a very wide range of distortion options. I prefer to use it as more of a clean crunch for power chords.
customer_reviews.author: ZLKTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Great Rar guitar pedal sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Extremely well made. Also has updated plug for standard 9 volt wall wart. A one trick pony, but does it well!
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: A Classic
customer_reviews.text: It's dead simple and built like a tank. A no-brainer for a first distortion pedal and could even end up being the only one you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Topha

customer_reviews.title: Year of the Rat
customer_reviews.text: Classic high pitched distortion that never disappoints. Sounds great with both single coil and humbucking pick-ups
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Woo

customer_reviews.title: Fuzz and Beyond
customer_reviews.text: I love adding channels to amps, and that is exactly what this pedal does. It helped me create a separate fuzz/distortion channel that makes my rig extra versatile. It's built to last and solid as a rock. I love the different dirt it gets combined with my MXR Carbon Copy nooned across the board. Insanity! I love my main rig distortion, but this definitely helps add depth, and doesn't tank my tone. Last distortion pedal you'll ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Kell Baker

customer_reviews.title: Still relevant after all these years
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great. It's not the most versatile but what it does it does well and is a classic for a reason... because it sounds great. Not many pedals hold their own like this one has. The Rat has been used by James Hatfield and many other bands of the 80s and 90s. It's one of the most basic but important pedals in my collection. It's my only distortion pedal. I've sold others back and keep returning to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Digelectric

customer_reviews.title: Great classic RAT sound.
customer_reviews.text: I love the good old RAT sound... I have an old Vintage Rat but prefer the smaller footprint and "on" LED indicator on this one. Sounds the same to me as the oldies.
customer_reviews.author: George V

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought one of these a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a LOT of dirt pedals over the years, but always avoided rats for some reason. I am an idiot. This thing is f'ing amazing.
customer_reviews.author: plk1975

customer_reviews.title: Classic Distortion
customer_reviews.text: RAT is a classic for a reason - sounds nice and dirty. For a distortion pedal there really is a bit more room to play around with the tone than most.
customer_reviews.author: Malted_Mook

customer_reviews.title: Cool Distortion!
customer_reviews.text: Classic, old school, easy to use distortion pedal. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pedal
customer_reviews.text: I love this pedal, you can get plenty of distortion/overdrive/fuzz sounds by playing with the settings. Really versatile, could be used in many genres. The pedal itself is built like a tank, good size, the input/output on the back lets you place the pedals around it closer on your pedalboard, its easy to change the 9v battery, just need to get a 3.5mm converter for your power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Memo

customer_reviews.title: The best distortion pedal out there.
customer_reviews.text: I always thought I hated heavily distorted guitars. That is, until I used this in my signal chain. It really allows for some really great tones that can be soft and subtle, or really crunchy. And it's also built like a tank. Its become a permanent pedal on my board that I'll probably never replace.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pedal, one of the best
customer_reviews.text: Quality is awesome. Very clear, very crisp sound. My only complaint is how bright it is, and the 9v setup requires an adapter to attach to a train or board without a battery. Other than that, great pedal. One of the best. Highly recommended for deeper toned guitars.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lane Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: This is placed After green overdrive pedal In front of a 100 watt tube amp. It's great, I am able to replicate my amps distortion tone well. Very versatile, probably. People ask me how I get my toan sooooo heavy I say the proco rat bra.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding for Clean Tube sound
customer_reviews.text: I got so tired of losing the "umpff" in my guitar sound when using my Rhythm and Lead Channels on my 100 watt tube head. I have tried overdrive after every other distortion and the RAT came up the clear winner for the sound I was looking for. I now drive the clean channel with the addition of the RAT. So simple and yet super tasty chunk without losing my tone. The filter knob is crucial to help find the sweet spot. If you want a super saturated metal sound, this might not be it for you but you may try 2 RATs inline. I've heard this to be a hefty chunk as well.
customer_reviews.author: New Father

customer_reviews.title: A classic
customer_reviews.text: You have a 303? Love distortion? This. Is. It. Hardfloor pedal of choice, albeit this one is a tad more fat. Nothing wrong with that.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Gosberg

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sounding pedal for heavier tunes also good for blues stuff, however I prefer my OCD drive for blues. This pedal has a lot more dirt than the OCD though which is why I bought it. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Um I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Um I love this thing. Favorite pedal I have owned. The range of distortion goes from 80s 90s rock to 2018 death metal and everywhere between.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly versatile pedal
customer_reviews.text: The Rat has been used by everyone from David Gilmour to Dave Grohl to give you a grasp of its range. It does everything from light crunch, to Marshall-style thick rhythms, to all out face-melting distortion. Rich harmonics, near infinite sustain, and a mid-range push that will cut through a mix like no other distortion pedal. This pedal has not left my board since the day I bought it. The fact that it's built like a tank ensures it's going to be around a long time after my playing days are over.
customer_reviews.author: C. Longo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use fully functional just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W. Petrino

customer_reviews.title: excellent i love it
customer_reviews.text: a classic love its sound the imperfection of the back noise adds a distintive quallity
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excelent distortion pedal
customer_reviews.text: Excelent distortion pedal, clear and with a wide range; you can get fuzz tones with an overdriven tube amp, and y it gets really heavy with another overdrive pedal before in the signal; great sound with singles, super strong enclosure. Just make sure you have the correct power adapter (this one needs a positive tip 3.5mm), or a polarity converter like the True Tone C35
customer_reviews.author: compulsivebuyer23

customer_reviews.title: Great hit from the 80’s and 90’s even better
customer_reviews.text: Used a Rat in the 80’s before the led. This one is perfect. I use it as a slight over drive and it cleans up perfectly just like I remember when turning down the guitar volume and beefs things up beautifully when guitar volume is cranked. Extremely musical sounding and very transparent
customer_reviews.author: Jim g.

customer_reviews.title: 80's Hard Rock Pedal.
customer_reviews.text: It's the rat an excellent pedal for 80's hard rock. I play blues so I needed an Xotic AC booster. Not the right pedal for me but it is great st what it does.
customer_reviews.author: Sandomar H

customer_reviews.title: The Rat
customer_reviews.text: For the $$ you can not beat this. Dirty sounds come out of this thing. Budget and badass. You can see why so many musicians use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Awsome pedal
customer_reviews.text: The perfect amount of distortion how ever toy adjust the dial. Love it. Love the sound.
customer_reviews.author: rob lezna

customer_reviews.title: Absolutly great distortion pedal
customer_reviews.text: Absolutly great distortion pedal, i'm loving it. It's fat, it has character, sounds huge, sounds articulated, its versatile,it's well known and respected, it's used by great bands, it's cheap, whant more? :)
customer_reviews.author: Sebastián Zahn

customer_reviews.title: Rat and roll
customer_reviews.text: Built like a tank and is a great distortion pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Culpepper

customer_reviews.title: Classic Distortion
customer_reviews.text: Classic distortion tones. The Fat switch is definitely worth the price increase versus the regular RAT pedal
customer_reviews.author: C. Coppola

customer_reviews.title: amazing pedal for such a low price
customer_reviews.text: amazing pedal for such a low price. Love this thing. Can do a light crunch to thick distortion with a hint of a fuzzish tone.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Just a good classic
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Nails the 80's motley crue sound for me. Mine had the newer style DC jack. Which was even nicer.
customer_reviews.author: noluck

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PEDAL
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PEDAL. I'm a bassist and I had previously been using the boss overdrive for my distortion, but this gives way more of the punch I was looking for. It has little feet which are great if your not using a pedal board, but they're easy to take off with a screwdriver so you can get it flush on your board as well. Well built and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Jelley23

customer_reviews.title: OK, so far.  No notable problems, just selecting the intensity.
customer_reviews.text: The lead-solo distortion seems to have slightly less attack & sustain, but without a balancing of noise reduction, IMO. Highly subjective analysis versus manufacturor's other units.
customer_reviews.author: GladesHermit

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Great pedal
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a pedal in my 6 years of guitar playing and I am very glad to say that this pedal is a good one. I'm still getting the gist of the knobs and changing the way it sounds, but all in all, it's pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Gooby

customer_reviews.title: Great price for great pedal
customer_reviews.text: Nice and crunchy if you want crunch. Nice and fuzzy if you want fuzz. Having fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on arrival. Was not able to ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on arrival. Was not able to open until past the return date due to cancer diagnosis, and now stuck with a heavy paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: I love the Rat pedal.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pedal. I can't believe that I waited so long to pick one up. rock on. my you tube demo video: [...]
customer_reviews.author: Jake Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved the Rat, but for some reason this one that I bought seems a little fizzy. No big deal though, I still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Handy

customer_reviews.title: Great first drive pedal
customer_reviews.text: Cool pedal, good as an OD, distortion, or fuzz. Equally good with humbuckers and single coils. Sometimes sounds thin by itself, but stacks really well with other drive pedals.
customer_reviews.author: S-Class

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: wish I would have known about this before the other distortion pedals I purchased over the years! This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Ann-MarieTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: and compressor made a awsome metal skull ripping tone I was thinking of a voodo mod but a friend told me about the pedal and man
customer_reviews.text: this pedal is for marshall amps it with a e.q. and compressor made a awsome metal skull ripping tone I was thinking of a voodo mod but a friend told me about the pedal and man its got more than enough gain i mean lots of distortion it and eq compressor makes for a great combo so get rid of all the tube screamers and go to the turbo rat if you got a marshall
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: The layout may be unconventional and arse-about but it is what it is and easy enough to adapt to
customer_reviews.text: A very rich sounding, versatile distortion that does just about anything; fuzz, OD, distortion, mild OD to heavy metal with zero to very little unwanted artefact noises. The layout may be unconventional and arse-about but it is what it is and easy enough to adapt to. It's extremely well built and a peek inside shows its boutique quality. I highly recommend this pedal.
customer_reviews.author: JP Champ

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Crunchy heavy rhythms and powerful solos
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a classic. I love it. Crunchy heavy rhythms and powerful solos. Just remember, like any pedal, it has its time and place (i.e., an arena in the 1980s) .
customer_reviews.author: Henry Watsky

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal, great price
customer_reviews.text: The Rat is everything I wanted in a distortion. It sounds just like Black Sabbath tone, yet it can be cranked up for some pretty good fuzz sounds, as well as dialed back for a mild overdrive. It is also great for stacking with other OD's. It is very versatile and great for the price. The only draw back is that the 9 volt power supply jack is smaller than most other pedals, so ProCo makes a separate power supply, or you can get an adapter at Radio Shack fairly cheap. Overall, great pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Galuppo

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted for the first 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Literally stopped giving a signal after about 30 minutes of use. Great sound, God awful wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lovett

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile dirt pedal.
customer_reviews.text: The filter and distortion knobs make this pedal extremely versatile. It can range from an overdrive (by rolling down distortion and the volume on your guitar) to a big muff-style fuzz (by setting the filter knob on full). It's a bit on the trebly side, but again, using the filter knob can change this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I am Yellowcard
customer_reviews.text: If you're a fan of hard rock (three days grace, breaking Benjamin, skillet) or surfer rock (Yellowcard, Switch foot, etc..) this is the exact same pedal that they use. It sounds great, feels great, looks great, can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Rat2  = As Good as old Rat
customer_reviews.text: I had a late '80s Rat and traded it. I love the one I got, but I felt the need for another dirt pedal, and Rat is one of the best. The Rat2 does not disappoint. It is every bit as good as the old Rat and still built like a tank.
customer_reviews.author: jwb

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal!
customer_reviews.text: Just going to say this....I'll never need another distortion pedal. Just brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: I got this because of justin chancellor and yeah im glad i didint settle for any other distortion pedal
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Better than digital anyday.
customer_reviews.text: Classic Pedal. Does that muffled sort of distortion for classic punk, or a clean overdrive for a trebly boost. Heavy duty and cool looking too, buy one. The only issue I had was the feet, I couldn't attach it to my pedal board initially, but they come off pretty easy and the screw holding the battery in place can be changed out. Now it's pedal board ready and velcroed up.
customer_reviews.author: Reed Iwasaki

customer_reviews.title: Oldie but goodie.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had gotten one sooner. Very useful, and can be tweaked, quite a bit. Sounds great with other pedals, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Turner

customer_reviews.title: Sharp sound!
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is what you want to get a variety of tone, sounds, bells and whistles out of your guitar! If your NOT looking for a "Fat" sound but more tone this toy cuts smoothly through it all! I put it in my gig bag and go to "open mics" use any amp there and it sounds great!
customer_reviews.author: RICCOH

customer_reviews.title: Works great, great warranty
customer_reviews.text: This device so far has been very durable. We have not had to test the seemingly endless warranty but as time goes by, it just keeps on working. My son loves it. Thankfully, his amplifier isn't that large or he would shake the house down!
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Essential Pedal for an extreme metal bassist
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with the over all build, sound, everything. It definitely plays nice with other pedals...
customer_reviews.author: Omar Inman

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pedal. Made like a tank. Great distortion or fuzz but can still do a decent overdrive. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you like that sound
customer_reviews.text: Rat distortion pedals have a distinctive sound. If you like that sound, you'll like this pedal.
customer_reviews.author: clutterjoe

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Not as crucial as you'd think but it's a must if you love Rat pedals. Clean Rat sound is clutch for solo compression. Turbo Rat is awesome too. You can dial in subtly different or way different sounds that still has Rat written all over it
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Bin Laden Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal for nasty distortion
customer_reviews.text: Great pedal for nasty distortion. Great for bass as well, doesn't cut out too much low end. Very useful for a clean boost too.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Orr

customer_reviews.title: Great Dirt Pedal
customer_reviews.text: Gives you a really nice distortion and can go from really dirty to just slightly overdriven.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T Cyr

customer_reviews.title: man this thing has some good sound and with only the slightest knob turn you ...
customer_reviews.text: man this thing has some good sound and with only the slightest knob turn you can get really differently good sounds
customer_reviews.author: Sir Racha

customer_reviews.title: Mother Rat
customer_reviews.text: The Turbo Rat is the Mother of all pedals. All the great stuff I read about it on this review site convinced me to try one and they were right! It is the best pedal I have ever used. I can't believe the Rat has been around for so long and I passed it up time after time. I love this pedal so much, I bought another one for my Rock and Roll daughter Sara. And she agrees it is awesome. The Kid is a chip off her Old Man, what can I say. The Turbo Rat is the closest I've come to sounding like the pros without spending thousands of dollars. You will see what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo De La Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, sound is subjective so I’ll let y’all look it up on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: chunk

customer_reviews.title: I'm a advocate
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with my proco rat!! Originally bought it because it was one of Cobains pedals, but it sounds awesome. Has a little bit of low end but can be adjusted with another pedal in the chain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... first one as foot switch was faulty but very happy with the replacement
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the first one as foot switch was faulty but very happy with the replacement,great sound works well with my TS9
customer_reviews.author: I. H. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Rat2 is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Couldn’t be happier for service and quality of product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: You're solos will sound amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pedal! If you want to rock you need to add it to your setup.
customer_reviews.author: oscar torres

customer_reviews.title: A great quality pedal
customer_reviews.text: We bought this distorion for our band guitar player, he is very happy with the sound and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Inti Alonso

customer_reviews.title: Rat Rules
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to guitars, and am using the RAT on an old Fender Champion lap steel. The sound through this device is simply amazing. Highly recommended. At first the distortion knob made some unwelcome pops when nearly off, but that disappeared within a few minutes, never to return. Built like a tank, excellent warranty, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: O4awesome don’t know why I didn’t buy one 30 years ago
customer_reviews.text: O4awesome don’t know why I didn’t buy one 30 years ago. So far I have bought four
customer_reviews.author: Neil s.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Distortion!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my DS-1 with this and could not be happier. Always thought my Boss Distortion pedals were missing something, they had the distortion I wanted but just seemed kind of bland. Whatever it was though the RAT has it and it sounds badass!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank and sounds awesome
customer_reviews.text: What to write about this classic? Built like a tank and sounds awesome. Just be sure to get the adapter as the power plug is not the standard Boss type.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tambroni

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pedal. I would buy another if anything happened to this one. It is an essential pedal for guitarists
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Thing rules. If you want to sound obnoxious in a punk band this is the move.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Klein

customer_reviews.title: Great distortion Pedal
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound of John Scofield's guitar and when I researched it I found out he gets the sound using a Pro Co Rat. This has a unique sound and was just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Tomhell

customer_reviews.title: Is there anything this little thing can't do?
customer_reviews.text: It works as an overdrive pedal, a fuzz pedal, a distortion pedal... it pretty much does a little bit of everything, it's just unbelievable, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: HERMELINDA VASQUEZ

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal!
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding distortion. I like how simple it it to use. Reminds me of old school Metallica.
customer_reviews.author: kc2pxp

customer_reviews.title: Turbo Rat distorion petal
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good distortion petal. I like the varation control that changes the amount of brightness in a specific areas of frequency. I can set if for any room I may be playing.
customer_reviews.author: Roy George

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Similar to the whiteface reissue
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Similar to the whiteface reissue. More bass can be dialed in with the fat switch, which is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: David A Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great sounds
customer_reviews.text: A great pedal. Heavily constructed, hum-less operation. The sounds you can get have quite a wide range, so this is a great distortion/drive/kick butt pedal. Rock onward.
customer_reviews.author: NedZeppelinII

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases for my board
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with klon-based overdrive pedals, like the EHX Soul Food (mine is a modded JHS version).
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: no power supply
customer_reviews.text: This pedal is great, only down side is it didn't come with a power supply and it uses the old school jack so standard 9 volt power supplies wont work so you need an adaptor, built like a tank though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love my rat
customer_reviews.text: The Rat is exactly what I thought it was...... A kick ass distortion unit....I also use a Herida Zendrive and they both complement each other... One clean overdrive the other a hard driving distortion ........ This vendor also got it to me in an expiditious manner at a great price. Great transaction !!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Kiersnowski

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I think I will buy a second one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ron J. Avant

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy crunch. Has a bit of a fuzz characteristic to it.
customer_reviews.author: AMP48

product_meta.title: Pro Co RAT2 Distortion Pedal
product_meta.description: style:RAT2The beauty of the RAT 2 lies in its versatility. Used as a primary distortion, it excels at arena rock rhythm tones and soaring leads. Do you have a powerful amp with too much headroom for the gig? The RAT 2 nails that sweet spot where a tube amp goes from sparkly clean to warm overdrive. Maybe you already love your amp's distortion. Use the RAT 2 as a boost for solos and get the extra kick you need.For any further queries please contact Pro Co's Technical Assistance (800) 467-2726 x1206 / Customer Service (800) 467-2726 x1123 / Quality Assurance (800) 467-2726 x2306.
feature_bullets: Used as a primary distortion, it excels at arena rock rhythm tones and soaring leads
Nails that sweet spot where a tube amp goes from sparkly clean to warm overdrive
Use the RAT 2 as a boost for solos and get the extra kick you need
